level.text: A foster parent shall not accept a child for foster care services from any child-placing agency or person other than CFSA or the agency.
Except as provided by §§ 6005.3 or 6005.4, the total number of children in a foster home:
May not exceed two (2) children under two (2) years of age;
May not exceed three (3) children under six (6) years of age; and
May not exceed three (3) foster children.
The total number of children in a foster home may not exceed two (2) children if any child in the foster home is:
Totally dependent on a caregiver for at least three (3) activities of daily living; or
CFSA may approve exceptions to the placement limits set forth in §§ 6005.2 or 6005.3 Exceptions shall be:
Made prior to the foster child’s placement;
For an exception to § 6005.2, limited to siblings and when there are no other children in the home; and
For an exception to § 6005.3, limited to one (1) additional foster child per home.
